comment.body: That's sad. I don't believe that bitcoin is dying, but I believe that the big money hipe with bitcoin is over for the next months. Who knows what happens next.
A very good alternative is Startpage.com, an organisation from the Netherlands. It underlies European law and shows the original Google resulst while you are staying anonimously.

@Daniell Mesquita: Right. There are many ways to go on with cryptocurrency. There are too many different kinds of currencies including their forks. In my eyes it will be a natural process that these all shrink together and few currencies will survive. And I really don't know which one this will be.
I like this style in b&w. Nice.

Even the younger generation is addicted to these cameras. 
The time before digital cameras was different: 
Who had made a photo of his/her meal?
Who had made tons of selfies?
Only totally weird people. These addicting smartphones changed the whole world. I don't know, if I like to know what happens in 2040...
Neither the Russian politicians nor the Nazis are the good ones. They weren't and never will be.
1 point for Firefox and a good reason to use the Tor browser (Firefox).
@leftside: You can use chromium, which is open source, to be on the safe side.
I am with Steven Hawking, who said that we should better have left the earth in 100 years. Life on earth should then be badder or nearly impossible.

You are not alone. In Germany we have the same problem and pay the same taxes. And ... our streets look same like yours. Many, many roads, including bridges are heavily damaged, even many motorways. In future perhaps I better buy a horse than a car.

@ulrichard: The things is that all car owners pay a yearly tax, which is normally reserved for repairing streets. But in the last 40 - 50 years this money was spent for other _important projects_. So this deal fails. The government has saved no money for the streets. Today they know that our streets are very desolate and try to give enormous amounts for their fixing. So much went wrong in the last decades. 
If I use a road in France or Luxembourg, I see it very clear. They have so pretty good streets. If you drive back to Germany you know, when you are here. It is the point, when you see potholes and the car is shaking. We are back home...
